title: ARAM will never be all random
body: I have been in so many games where I face bs comps that couldn't be random, its about time you fix it Riot pls

replies.body: I get galio and anivia way too often for it to be random.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gambler%27s_fallacy

Random does not mean it will always be different.

Having a Gnar in three games in a row when theres over 100 champs, sure random doesn't mean it will always be different but getting the same champion in 3 arams shouldn't be a thing.

You got {{champion:150}} 3 games in a row? That's lucky.

Also if you're saying others got {{champion:150}} 3 games in a row, well, maybe they have less than 100 champions so their chance of getting {{champion:150}} was increased? Again luck.... I dunno. Sounds like luck.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infinite_monkey_theorem
Alright, I don't understand the math or randomness but I heard somewhere that true random does not exist on a computer. Whatever that means.

No, but it means the chances of me getting anivia and galio in 20% of aram games over a sample size of about 80 games is very small. I understand the math involved, and it is clear ARAM weights towards specific champions for some reason.
except if you give it enough time, any combination is possible
